entry.title: K-222 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Soviet submarine K-222 (pictured) was the fastest submarine ever built?

entry.title: Linguistic Atlas of the Iberian Peninsula (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that linguist Aníbal Otero was imprisoned for espionage while working on fieldwork for the Linguistic Atlas of the Iberian Peninsula?

entry.title: Eldridge Milton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that future NFL linebacker Eldridge Milton liked playing with alligators at a young age?

entry.title: Big 8 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nebraska TV station Big 8 was a big bust, losing nearly $5 million between 1983 and 1986?

entry.title: Sarah Maria Griffin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a fantasy novel by Irish poet and author Sarah Maria Griffin was sent to around 200,000 ticket-holders of the music festival Tomorrowland?

entry.title: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a gameplay demonstration of Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six boosted its popularity when it accidentally showed AI teammates rescuing hostages by themselves?

entry.title: Wanda Wesołowska (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Wanda Wesołowska has named 40 genera and 572 species of animals?

entry.title: Sam H. Harris Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite plans to restore the Sam H. Harris Theatre in the 1990s, it became an entrance to a wax museum?
